wikipedia_page.main: Rupert Clement George Carington, 4th Baron Carrington,  (18 December 1852 – 11 November 1929), known as the Hon. Rupert Carington from 1868 to 1928, was a British soldier and Liberal Party politician.

response: * Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington (1852–1929), English Liberal MP and soldier

link_mentions.page: List of political families in the United Kingdom
response: ******* Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington (1852–1929), MP and peer. Third son of Robert.

Charles Robert Carrington was born at Whitehall on 16 May 1843, the son of Robert Carrington, 2nd Baron Carrington, and his second wife Charlotte, the younger daughter of Peter Drummond-Burrell, 22nd Baron Willoughby de Eresby. The Hon. Sir William Carington and Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington, were his younger brothers, while Peter Carington, 6th Baron Carrington, was his grand-nephew. He was educated at Eton and Trinity College, Cambridge. He was a lifelong friend of King Edward VII, having first met him in 1854.

link_mentions.page: Rupert Clement George Carington, 4th Baron Carrington

response: Carington married Juliet Warden, daughter of Francis Warden, of New York, on 23 September 1871. They had no children. She died in November 1913. Carington only survived her by eleven months and died aged 69. Charles Wynn-Carington, 1st Marquess of Lincolnshire, was his elder brother, and Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington, his younger brother.

He succeeded to the title in 1929. Carrington was the son of Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington, and Edith, daughter of John Horsefall and Mary Maiden. He fought in the First World War as a captain in the Grenadier Guards and was twice wounded. After the war he served as a Deputy Lieutenant and Justice of the Peace for Devon. He succeeded his father in the barony in 1929, but never spoke in the House of Lords.
* Rupert Carington, 4th Baron Carrington (1852–1929), British soldier and Liberal Party politician
